Check Saketini out !. Good food, service and atmosphere. You will find a deal that will work with you.. happy hour or reverse happy hour ,you 're bound to find something that will fill your belly with deliciousness and a drink that will warm ya up!

Came back here recently, about 9 months since my last trip.  Disappointed, I must say.  Quality has gone downhill, it seems.  Fish not as fresh as last visit, and rolls have taken on a more is less approach.  That is, pile on more goop but give 'em less fish.  The sauces are overwhelming, sticky and sweet.  I don't remember this the last visit.  The sauces should complement the fish, not drown it.

This has got to be the worst place ever ! Saw roaches crawling in the bathroom. Sushi maker doesn't use gloves and saw him taking out trash and then came back and made more sushi!!!The waitresses add their own gratuity to your your bill! Even if it's just one person they add whatever they want to their bill. When asked to speak to supervise they make excuses that managers are available. Please check your receipts as they add whatever amount they want as their tip. STAY AWAY FROM THIS FILTHY PLACE

Very friendly staff! Great sushi specials all day. A full bar and comfortable atmosphere. They're open until 2am but you want to get in here before 1:30 so they don't close the kitchen on you if you're coming in to eat. Sit at the bar if you want to watch some TV as you relax to eat and drink.

Let's start with the appearance . Not the cleanest . The chairs are stained they have boxes and garbage in one of the see through sushi stations the chairs have tennis balls on them. There is graffiti on the walls come on a can of paint is like 20$ .. We got the d backs roll .. More like the condom roll it was wrapped in spring roll film so horrible and groose . Never eating here again .

Disappointing to say the least....
This is my 4th time here and I wouldn;t have gone here so many times if it wasn't the proximity to MCC. Each and everytime I have been rather dissapointed with teh level of service which has been slow and blase at the best of times.
 This time around I had to wait 20 miniutes at teh sushi bar (after my order) before teh chef showed up. By then I had lost interest in suchi and Saketini as a whole. I would understand if this place was crowded but there were only 2 other groups and that too none of them were at the bar.

Note to self: Never venture here again

This place has a bunch of great sushi rolls. They are a little pricier than some other places but their sushi is better than a lot of places so I feel they are fairly priced for what you get and have "half off" prices on many of their rolls during their happy hour. Cocktails are good and the service is always fast and the waitresses are friendly.

I went here a few weeks ago and ended up only getting one drink because they were out of all of the alcohols required to make a manhattan (which is what the BF wanted). I had their saketini and it was very weird and tasted a lot like seaweed. Not my fave. Their menu didn't have a lot of vegetarian items, so we passed and went somewhere else. I don't think I would come back here again for drinks, but I may try their food sometime.

I love this place! On top of happy hour, they have half off Sushi from 6-10 and reverse happy hour after that. Their rolls are delicious and the food comes out fast. They even do take out! This is my go to sushi place

My girlfriend and I have been coming here for around 4 years now. The sushi is great! They have reasonable portions with a large variety of different types of sushi. I suggest the "Firecracker" or "Cinderella" rolls. 

As for there other food options, I have not tried very many but the Ramen was pretty good and the "Chicken Katsu" was delicious as well. 

The service use to be terrible here. We didn't care because we loved the food so much but I'm happy to say that within the last year the service is much better! They are quick to take your order and we never have any issues with refills. All of the servers are bubbly and very nice as well. 

Although the place may look dingy (it's a little run down and could use a remodel), do not let that affect your decision to dine here. Enjoy the happy hour, and happy eating!

I love sakitini . However I was really disappointed because I called at 12:50 to order a California roll to go. Ps, They close their kitchen at 1AM. The guy on the phone told me they closed their kitchen down early because it was slow. Honestly, I work in a restaurant I get it but you can't just pick and choose when you want to close down the kitchen. What makes it worse is that their open until 2!!!! Unsatisfied customer.
Great Karaoke place and happy hour menu!

I love this place. I've been here several times and I'm never dissatisfied with the food or service. All the servers are helpful,polite,and ALWAYS accommodating. I've never had something there I didn't like! Totally recommend this place to anyone wanting to try sushi for their first time!

Very very expensive, food...never order it, service...none. WOW!!! This place really tops every & any place I have ever been.
Came here late at night because I wanted some soju & something to pick at but it was a huge mistake from my end!
SORRY!!!

This place is cool!  Almost any time of day they have some rolls or apps on special.  3-6 PM is when the most stuff is on happy hour though.  I tried the Jelly Fish roll: had spicy octopus and cucumber with cream cheese inside.  I had to pick the cream cheese out (I find cream cheese in sushi revolting) but otherwise it was great!
I also got salmon nigiri and the spicy tuna roll. Overall the fish tasted very fresh to me. But watch out for the spicy tuna! I couldn't eat it all because it was so spicy!

I'd definitely come here again. My dining companion and I were full and our total bill was only $20.52!

"I think that without sushi, there would be no David Hasselhoff because sushi is like the perfect way of describing the insides of David Hasselhoff. He is like a protein, clean and easy. That's how I feel about myself." ? David Hasselhoff

This place is decent.  Friendly staff, ample seating, open until 2AM, there's a karaoke room, et cetera.  They even have a generous amount of time allotted for Happy Hour and Reverse Happy Hour.  Too bad the rolls are small and mediocre for the price they're asking.  I mean $7 for barely any salmon skin?  You're kidding me, right?  And $7 for a cocktail with barely any booze makes this girl sad.  Oh well.  I only come here when out-of-state and out-of-country friends want to mingle.

Karaoke:  I love to karaoke here!  The cheapest place to karaoke as it is only 5 bucks a person and the room is extremely nice in there.  The songs aren't as updated as other karaoke places, but it's neat how they have a lot of different songs in different Asian languages.  

Food:  The taste is alright, but the prices are cheap.  The servers are really nice, but the service can be really slow as they have very few workers in there.

This is my favorite sushi place by far!! The service is ALWAYS great and the food is so good! I love their happy hour and reverse happy hour! Their prices are so reasonable and I love how late they are open! This is my go to place and probably my favorite restaurant! Krista and Amanda are always so friendly and are by far my favorite servers! Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a casual sushi restaurant with great service!!

Their rolls are super inventive....and they stay open later than most Sushi Places in the Valley (2am).  

Their Happy Hour is insane! Ex: 99 cent beers on Tuesday!

I've never had a disappointing meal here, and I am pretty hard to please when it comes to sushi.

Recommendations:
Signature Roll
Squid Salad
Yellowtail Collarbone
Drinks, Drinks...drinks.

They have a little karaoke room, and full bar you can make use of as well.

1 Thing: When it's busy, be prepared to order everything at once...or you will be waiting.

My friend and I finished a workout and realized we were hungry and craving sushi.  We were frantically trying to find a place to eat sushi that was open late.  First of all, there aren't that many great sushi places in the Valley, simply because the fish is not fresh like any of the coastal states.  We were still on a mission.

Saketini's was open pretty late so we made stop over here.  We got a sashimi platter, albacore with crab roll, and a few other things.  The albacore with crab roll (forgot name) was very delicious.  Some of the sashimi peaces were good, but some were not as great.

Overall, we got our fix of sushi at a very late hour.  One thing that drops the rating of the restaurant is we got an automatic 20% tip added on.  We were only a party of two.  I usually leave a pretty good tip, but I do not like it when a restaurant mandates a tip.  A tip is something I feel is up to the customer based on his experience.

This restaurant is full of amazing workers, delicious food and an enjoyable environment. I've been coming her with my fianc√© and any friends for almost 4 years and I recommend as the best sushi I've ever had. Never disappointed. Fast service. Friendly and kawaiiiii chefs and servers. Never had a complaint. I come here for all birthdays, anniversaries, etc. this is a must visit
Absolutely Delish. There is always a special happening which is wallet friendly. Only suggestion is more attentive staff, but the food is YUM YUM YUM YUM!!!!!

Very mixed feelings here....

the sushi is great....VERY tasty. The red dragon roll was soooooooooo good. In fact, all the rolls were very flavorful. The nigiri was ok.....I think it's more about the maki then anything at this place. (the other food was kind of mediocre.....the teriyaki is bleh, and the (tuna, was it?) cheek was overcooked and not seasoned)

However......

I'm giving two stars because service. is. horrible.

There were probably about 50 people there last night (when we were leaving, they said it was weird for it to be that busy on a Thursday, normally Monday's are bad....go figure) Anyways, with 50 people there, there were only two servers. (they said one got sick and didn't show.....but, apparently their phone must not have been working either, because they failed to call someone else to come in) So, right from the get go, service was slow. It took a good 10 minutes before anyone attended us after being seated.  A weird thing was, we told the Maitre'D (who was also the other server) that we would possibly be 4, but the others were late. She insited we sit at a small two seater table until we were sure they were coming, to keep the big tables open for groups (wait a sec.....I just realized they said it's 'weird to be this busy on a Thursday'......huh. strange.) Anyways, our friends did end up coming and we had to move tables in the middle of our meal. 

The happy hour is....not the best, anyways. My husband ordered a wells, after another 10 or so mins of waiting, he asked about his drink, which the server said they were out of, then realized they WEREN'T out, and 20 minutes later finally brought the drink..... The thing about the sushi on the happy hour menu is that, for 4.50 you get 4 pieces. My friend had to order two because one wasn't enough. So, she ended up paying full price anyways. 

As for the restaurant itself....it's caught between two worlds. I'm not sure if it's more restaurant, or more club. In either case, it needs a face lift. It feels like an old cruiseship.....(brown and orange aren't the most inviting colors).....The people that were there were pretty much all under 25 and loud and rambunctious....It was about 10:30 at night, but...I didn't think this was a club....... 

I think I'll bookmark this place as one to come to when everything else is closed (they're open till 2am) and I get that midnight sushi craving, otherwise; Thank you, but I'll pass......

This is the closest sushi place to me after Crazy Sushi & Crab (see previous review) and Senor Sushi (due to reviews, I have no plans to go here.) I live in the heart of Mesa's Asian Business District, so I rarely venture outside of it for the foods that I love. 

Saketini has a decent happy hour and several rolls. People love this place and are regulars. I've been a couple of times and even brought friends. One of the last times I ordered off the happy hour menu I thought, wow there's a lot of crab mix in here (a roll that the main ingredient was supposed to be tuna.) I gave them the benefit of the doubt and thought, well maybe they're just having an off day. I went back this weekend and was disappointed, because they're stuffing the rolls with crab mix when that's not what is being advertised; the last time wasn't a fluke. If I wanted a California roll (which is not even proper sushi), I would have ordered one. I asked the waiter if he could ask the chef about it and the waiter began to argue with me and eventually said, well it's probably just to bring costs down. I said, oh okay I understand, we'll take the check. I won't go back. If you claim to be a sushi place, why are you cutting corners? It's a culture, it's an art. Maybe their specialty rolls are better and the happy hour rolls are a scheme to make extra money with small portions? Who knows. I'm not really interested in going back. Really, it's a shame, I liked going there.

Side note: I feel like an absolute fool for forgetting that Toh Zan Nagasaki Grill is within WALKING distance from Saketini, has glowing reviews, and every time I drive by I go, "I still need to go in there! Definitely a Japanese mom and pop place." I've looked at the menu and it looks amazing and well priced. I will be going there the next time I am craving sushi.
